conclusion: The flow rate Q can be determined by the formula Q = (1/4) π d^2 v, where v is the velocity of the liquid.
The velocity v is given by v = E/(Bd).
Substitute v = E/(Bd) into the formula for Q to get Q = (1/4) π d^2 (E/(Bd)).
Simplify to find Q = (1/4) π d (E/B).
The flow rate Q of the liquid in the pipe is (1/4) π d (E/B).
